about_me.title: About me
about_me.paragraph:
I'm a student and developer passionate about creating modern web applications. I work across the whole stack, building frontends with React, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS, and developing backends with Node.js and PostgreSQL. My projects focus on smooth user experiences, efficient data handling, and solid technical foundations.

I like exploring and learning new technologies and improving how things are built, whether it‚Äôs refining architecture, optimizing performance, or experimenting with better development workflows.

Outside of web development, I also explore game development in C++ and Unity.

works_list.title: Acnod
works_list.description: Acnod was a project me and my friend <link href='https://skymmel.eu' rel='noreferrer' target='_blank'}>Vojtƒõch Skyba</link> were working on. It was a freelance website on which we offered website development services.

works_list.title: Nagy 3D
works_list.description: This website is for a company named Nagy 3D that offers 3D printing and scanning in the northwestern region of the Czech Republic. It offers a minimalistic and clean look so the user can have a good experience.

works_list.title: Monitoring Dashboard
works_list.description: A self-hosted uptime and incident monitoring tool built for clarity and reliability. It tracks service availability, logs incidents, handles maintenance windows, and generates daily uptime stats.

works_list.title: Slenderman UE5
works_list.description: A short horror game clone built in Unreal Engine 5. Original game: Slender: The Eight Pages by Parsec Productions. It features page collection, basic enemy AI, and a full win/lose loop. Focused on learning C++, AI behavior and completing a playable game.

works_list.title: Raylib Games
works_list.description: This is a collection of games I created using Raylib in C++. Each game demonstrates a variety of gameplay mechanics, challenges, and programming techniques I implemented.

acnod.description: Acnod was a project me and my friend <link href='https://skymmel.eu' rel='noreferrer' target='_blank'}>Vojtƒõch Skyba</link> were working on. It was a freelance website on which we offered website development services.

nagy3d.description: This website is for a company named Nagy 3D that offers 3D printing and scanning in the northwestern region of the Czech Republic. It offers a minimalistic and clean look so the user can have a good experience.

monitoring_dashboard.description: A self-hosted uptime and incident monitoring tool built for clarity and reliability. It tracks service availability, logs incidents, handles maintenance windows, and generates daily uptime stats, all powered by .NET 9, Blazor, and PostgreSQL. Background workers do the heavy lifting while a clean Tailwind-styled UI keeps everything easy to read.

slenderman.description: A short horror game clone built in Unreal Engine 5. Original game: Slender: The Eight Pages by Parsec Productions. It features page collection, basic enemy AI, and a full win/lose loop. Focused on learning C++, AI behavior and completing a playable game.

intro.p1: A small horror game project inspired by Slender: The Eight Pages, built in Unreal Engine 5.
intro.p2: This project was for me to learn and finish developing a playable game in UE5. Not all planned features were implemented as I focused on finishing a playable version.

gameplay.title: üïπÔ∏è Gameplay
items: Jump scares, ambient SFX, win/lose states

features.title: üéÆ Features Implemented
items: Basic AI: Slenderman moves and teleports around the player
Slenderman model and simple jumpscare system

planned.title: üöß Missing or Planned Features
planned.note: These may be added in a future polish update.

learned.title: üí° What I Learned
items: Building a full gameplay loop from start to finish
Managing project scope and avoiding perfectionism
Using C++ to handle AI and interaction logic
Setting up pause/lose/win widgets in UE5

play.title: üóÇÔ∏è How to Play
play.text: Download <link1 href='https://git.jakooob.dev/Jakooob/slenderman-unreal/releases/download/latest/Slenderman%20-%20Windows.zip' rel='noreferrer' target='_blank'}>here</link1> or from the releases section in <link2 href='https://git.jakooob.dev/Jakooob/slenderman-unreal' rel='noreferrer' target='_blank'}>Gitea</link2>.

license.title: üìÅ Source Code License
license.text: This project is shared for learning purposes only. Please do not reuse commercial/marketplace assets included in the repo unless you own them yourself.
